meanings.definition: A protective barrier around a well or cistern.
meanings.sent1: The puteal around the well kept people safe from falling in.
meanings.sent2: The ancient puteal around the cistern was beautifully crafted.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous children pretended the puteal was a castle wall.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed within the puteal, like a protective shield.
meanings.sent5: The old puteal stood like a guardian, watching over the well.

meanings.definition: A stone or marble enclosure around a sacred spot.
meanings.sent1: The puteal surrounding the sacred spot was intricately carved.
meanings.sent2: Visitors admired the ornate puteal enclosing the sacred area.
meanings.sent3: The pigeons perched on the puteal, as if guarding the sacred spot.
meanings.sent4: The moonlight illuminated the puteal, making it glow like magic.
meanings.sent5: The ancient puteal exuded an aura of reverence around the sacred spot.

meanings.definition: A structure used to mark a boundary or protect a sacred area.
meanings.sent1: The puteal served as a clear boundary for the sacred area.
meanings.sent2: The villagers built a puteal to protect the sacred ground.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy ran circles around the puteal, marking its territory.
meanings.sent4: The sunlight filtered through the puteal, creating a halo effect.
meanings.sent5: The intricate designs on the puteal symbolized the sacredness of the area.
